title: Job Advertisement
welcomeText:
Job purpose:
The Principal is responsible for leading, managing, and developing the Presidential School to ensure that it provides the highest standards of education and pastoral care to all students. The principal is also responsible for developing and maintaining effective relationships with all stakeholders, including PIIMA, students, staff, parents, the Board of Governors/Trustees, HR, and the wider community.

Salary: $200,000 annually

Working time: 5/2, from 8 am to 5 pm

Key responsibilities:
  • Recruit, retain, and develop high-quality staff, providing effective leadership and management to ensure that they are motivated, engaged, and supported in their roles.
  • Ensure that students receive high-quality career advice and guidance that prepares them for further education, training, and employment.
  • Promote the Presidential School effectively, building a positive reputation in the local community and beyond.
  • Manage the budget, resources, and facilities of the Presidential School to ensure that they are used effectively and efficiently.
  • Ensure that the Presidential School meets all statutory and regulatory requirements.

Person Specification for principal


Essential Criteria:
  • A relevant degree or equivalent professional qualification.
  • IELTS: at least 7.0
  • A teaching qualification and evidence of successful teaching experience.
  • Significant experience working in a senior leadership role in a school/college.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with a range of stakeholders.
  • Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects effectively.
Desirable Criteria:
  • Experience working in an international school setting or with students from diverse cultural backgrounds.
  • An understanding of financial management and budgetary control.
  • An ability to inspire and motivate staff and students to achieve their full potential.
